Buckley has noted that Irish cases of incest continued to be heard in camera after 1922, while in Northern Ireland and Britain this practice ceased. Furthermore, in Ireland incest continued to be classified as a misdemeanour with a maximum sentence of seven years. The average sentence for the crime fell by five years to two years’ imprisonment between 1922 and 1950
